response.original_title: Shreds of Violence, Threads of Repair
response.overview: “Shreds of Violence, Threads of Repair,” a film by Assiya Issemberdieva, is a video essay that interrogates Soviet colonization and its cinematic representations. Drawing on the theoretical frameworks of Frantz Fanon and Edward Said, the work weaves together critique and reflection, exposing the lingering scars of empire while probing the possibilities of repair.
response.title: Shreds of Violence, Threads of Repair
